abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed credits would help the
            country increase it's productive capacity and exports
            during a critical phase of the economic rehabilitation
            program. The credits would finance eligible imports of: (i)
            agricultural inputs and tools, spare parts for agricultural
            machinery, and equipment, including fishing equipment; (ii)
            vehicles, maintenance equipment, spare parts, and fuel for
            the transportation sector; (iii) vehicles, equipment, and
            machinery for the water supply/sanitation sector; (iv)
            equipment and spare parts for the electrical and
            telecommunications sectors; and (v) vaccines, equipment,
            vehicles and medicines for the health sector. The credits
            will also provide technical assistance to the Government for
            credit administration, procurement, and utilization of the
            items imported.
